name: shirr
content:
shirr verb [T]
(CLOTH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you shirr cloth, you pull it into small folds by sewing a number of threads through it and then pulling the threads tight: This top is shirred across the bodice. She wore a long shirred skirt.
More examplesFewer examplesThe old lady was wearing a brown dress with a shirred skirt.I bought a new jacket that was shirred at the sleeve.The material was shirred into a taut shape.

shirr verb [T]
(EGGS)
If you shirr eggs, you remove them from their shells and bake them in a dish: I ate a plate of shirred eggs topped with paté. The brunch menu included smoked salmon, shirred eggs, and waffles.
